summary: I have had an inquisitive mind from a young age and have always shown a desire to explore. I believe that my curiosity and imagination have brought me to where I am today and given me the drive to push forward. I consider myself flexible, easily adaptable and diligent. When I am dealing with a task, I fully commit to it, tackle it with real passion and give attention to every detail. Furthermore, I am always open to learning new things and expanding my horizons.

awards.title: Department of Management and HRM Prize for Best Student BA International Business and Finance
awards.description: Based on my academic performance, I received the "Top Student" award for my cohort.

projects.title: The Inclusivision Project
projects.description: Joined a discussion panel for “The Inclusivision Project” at the Faculty of Economics and Business (University of Groningen), a project that aims to foster bottom-up initiatives aimed at different aspects of diversity such as educational background, sexual orientation, gender, ability or color. The project encourages various stakeholders within the faculty (students, staff, study associations, and others) to share their ideas on diversity and inclusion. My main responsibilities included proposing and evaluating initiatives, communicating with relevant stakeholders, and exploring implementation options for the proposed initiatives. More specifically, I proposed the creation of a sensory room on campus which was later realized. My participation in the panel enabled me to gain an insight into ways of fostering diveristy and inclusion in the academic environment. I joined the panel again in 2022 and 2023.

projects.title: Business Meets University
projects.description: Attended a crash course in scientific knowledge about creativity and innovation and was assigned an organization which underwent an innovation scan as part of the Business Meets University event organized by the University of Groningen. Analyzed the outcomes of the company’s innovation scan (i.e., inspected the company’s innovation scan report) within a small team of fellow students and compiled a set of practical advice that the company can implement to increase creativity and innovation. On the day of the event, our team had a 45-minute session with the company’s representatives during which they were informed about the outcomes of their company’s innovation scan and presented with advice on how to improve creativity and innovation in their organization. By getting involved in this project, I got a chance to further advance my knowledge regarding organizational creativity and innovation. Furthermore, I got to learn how to interpret a company’s innovation scan report and provide actionable advice based on its outcomes.

projects.title: FC Groningen Digital Business Challenge
projects.description: Participated in the digital business challenge organized by FC Groningen, the Digital Business Center of the University of Groningen, and IBM. Worked in an international multi-disciplinary student team on a task assigned by the football club. We had three days to develop an idea that would help FC Groningen to increase sponsor engagement and enable them to develop and maintain a long-standing relationship with their sponsors. Integrating a digital aspect into our proposed solution was a crucial part of the process. During the event, we got a chance to interact with various business advisors and discuss our idea with them. We also attended a professional pitch training session. On the last day of the event, we presented our idea in the form of a short pitch in front of a group of judges. This project gave me an opportunity to further expand my professional and personal network, strengthen my pitching skills, and practice the development of solutions to real-life business challenges.

projects.title: Sustainable Business Challenge
projects.description: Participated in the Sustainable Business Challenge, an online event organized by two Dutch and three UK universities. For the 2021 challenge, the teams worked on an assignment for the UK’s Civil Service and were tasked with proposing an idea that relates to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The aim was to develop an initiative that would enable selected UK industries to become more sustainable. We were given three days to create and advance our idea which was delivered as a 5-minute video pitch. We chose to focus on the education sector and our project made it to the finals by being placed among the top 6 teams. This provided us with a chance to further defend our idea in front of a group of judges. Apart from giving me another opportunity to work in an international multidisciplinary team, this project has further broadened my knowledge about sustainable business practices and allowed me to practice pitching business ideas.

projects.title: AIM2Flourish
projects.description: Participated in the AIM2Flourish initiative which is a program of the Fowler Center for Business as an Agent of World Benefit at the Weatherhead School of Management (Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio, United States). The aim of the project was to examine a positive and profitable business innovation that incorporates the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Our group visited a social enterprise that focuses on maximizing people’s well-being and minimizing the risk of preventable illnesses by providing a science-based personalized approach to personal training and physiotherapy. After our visit to the company and an interview with the business founder, we wrote up the business’ story describing the innovation and its benefits and published it on the AIM2Flourish online platform. Overall, this project provided me with me a better understanding of sustainable business practices.

projects.title: WikiRate
projects.description: Participated in the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) Research program on the WikiRate platform. WikiRate is a nonprofit organization which hosts an open data platform that compiles environmental, social and governance data and makes them freely accessible to everyone. The aim of the SDGs Research program was to evaluate the sustainability reporting practices of a given company against more than 70 metrics linked to the United Nation’s SDGs and the Global Standards of Sustainability Reporting (GRI Standards). In particular, the project focused on the businesses’ contribution to the SDGs. I assessed the annual and sustainability reports of a multinational postal service company with accordance to the WikiRate metrics and recorded the outcomes of my analysis on the online platform. This project helped me gain an insight into sustainability reporting practices, the SDGs, the GRI Standards and the criteria used to determine the quality of corporate sustainability reports.

company.name: Department of Marketing (FEB), University of Groningen

profile_positions.company: Department of Marketing (FEB), University of Groningen
profile_positions.description:
Was employed as a Junior Lecturer at the Department of Marketing at the Faculty of Economics and Business (University of Groningen) shortly after graduating with my Master’s in Marketing Management. Currently involved in the following courses: Statistics for Pre-Master, Digital Marketing Analytics, Marketing for Economics and Business Economics, Pre-Master Research Paper, Bachelor Thesis for International Business, Bachelor Thesis for Economics and Business Economics. 

Main responsibilities:
◆ Teaching tutorial groups
◆ Supervising pre-Master students with their research papers and Bachelor students with their theses
◆ Assisting students with assignments/projects, providing feedback 
◆ Grading assignments and exams
profile_positions.title: Junior Marketing Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Completed a 5-month marketing internship at Zero to One – an international start-up accelerator. Zero to One offer acceleration and facilitation services to start-ups (both Dutch and international) and are also involved in a range of projects aimed at the development of effective start-up ecosystems.

Main responsibilities:
◆ Managing the company’s social media channels (including content creation)
◆ Exploring various search engine optimization (SEO) strategies, setting up SEO experiments
◆ Preparing marketing reports
◆ Monitoring and analyzing KPIs (social media and website KPIs)
profile_positions.title: Marketing Intern

profile_positions.description:
Joined a student consultancy team via the SIM Consulting Platform and worked on a project together with a group of fellow students. The aim of the project was to provide our client, who was seeking to enter a new foreign market, with a detailed overview of the selected market.

Main responsibilities:
◆ Providing a general market overview: main market characteristics and trends
◆ Analyzing selected industries: overview, trends, potential customers and competitors
◆ Compiling a set of strategic advice on entering the new market
profile_positions.title: Student Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Worked in a student consultancy team on a project for The Chesterfield Brand - a Dutch retailer of high-quality leather bags and accessories. The main aim of the project was to provide our client with detailed market insights. 

Main responsibilities:
◆ Competitive environment analysis: market trends identification, market segmentation
◆ Exploring competitive marketing strategies 
◆ Presenting project outcomes to company representatives
profile_positions.title: Student Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Worked in a student consultancy team on an assignment in collaboration with Glasgow Airport. The main aim of the project was to provide insights on the needs and expectations of a specific customer segment and recommendations on how to serve the given customer group effectively.

Main responsibilities:
◆ Defining the main characteristics of the given customer segment
◆ Collecting and analyzing customer segment data
◆ Presenting project outcomes to the airport’s management
profile_positions.title: Student Consultant

volunteer_experiences.description: I volunteered at one of British Heart Foundation’s charity shops in Glasgow from 2016 to 2019. My key tasks involved working on the shop floor (operating the till, tidying up, helping customers), assisting in the stock room (stock processing and stock display), as well as assisting other members of staff with their duties. This not only gave me the chance to gain retail insight and customer service experience but also to strengthen my independent and teamwork skills. Furthermore, it enabled me to get actively involved in a charity organization and to learn how it operates. Overall, one of the most valuable experiences was the opportunity to interact with an extremely diverse group of customers from different social and cultural backgrounds.

Together with a group of my classmates, we organized a charity fundraiser for Glasgow Children’s Hospital Charity. We had a fundraising stall on our university's campus for two days where we were actively approaching fellow students and staff asking them to participate in our charity sale. At the same time, we held an online fundraiser. Additionally, there was also a foodbank collection point for a local foodbank available at our stall. After the fundraising event, we visited the Royal Hospital for Children in Glasgow which is being supported by Glasgow Children’s Hospital Charity. During our visit, we handed the donations to a representative from the charity and were given a tour of the hospital’s premises where we were shown projects the charity helped to finance.

Took part in NLdoet – a volunteer campaign organized every March in the Netherlands. The aim of the campaign is to engage citizens in social activities and promote volunteer work. In fact, NLdoet (which is organized by Oranje Fonds) is the largest volunteer campaign in the Netherlands. I chose a project in a children’s center where visually impaired children receive specialist care. The goal was to enhance the environment for the center’s clients and hence I helped to paint one of the classrooms.

Volunteered for Techstars Startup Weekend Groningen, a 54-hour event which is part of the world’s largest learning programme for entrepreneurs. In the given time, aspiring entrepreneurs work in teams with the goal of creating their own startups and are thus given a unique opportunity to experience the startup life. They also have a chance to work with mentors, investors, other startup founders, and sponsors. My main responsibilities involved assisting the participants as well as the organizing team. This enabled me to gain further insight into startup creation and gave me a chance to interact with a diverse range of talented individuals.

Joined Circle’s Economy Knowledge Hub as contributor for the period of one month. Circle Economy is a non-profit organization that works with businesses, cities, and governments by helping them with their transition to circular economy. Their main focus are practical and scalable solutions that can accelerate sustainable development. Many of such solutions are presented in Circle Economy’s Knowledge Hub - an online library of circular economy case studies. This open-collaborative library is accessible to anyone who is interested in contributing to the global transition to circular economy. I contributed to the Knowledge Hub with several case studies focused on sustainable projects in Africa. This allowed me to learn more about the implementation of circular economy solutions.
